name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
A girl submitted her experience tonight.
She just went downstairs to eat something.
She was not allowed to enter the community because she did not do the nucleic acid test, and was scolded by the epidemic prevention personnel at the door.
After that, she ran around the city to various places where nucleic acid tests were done, found the police, and wandered around the city at a loss as they shirked responsibility. Finally, at one o'clock in the morning, a kind-hearted old man who was guarding the door let her go home...

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Many friends in Guangdong sent me this picture today, saying they were worried that Guangzhou would become Shanghai in April.
Interestingly, many people who advocated zero-COVID at the time took Shenzhen as an example, saying that Shanghai should not "lie flat"
As a result, six months later, Guangzhou, which did not choose to lie flat, also reached this data.
I have repeatedly said that the fundamental reason why dynamic zero-COVID is unsustainable is not for "lying flat", but because Omicron cannot defend at all.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In fact, as early as 2020, Europe also locked down cities and imposed curfews. Only one person in a family could go out to buy groceries, and all other stores except for fixed centralized stores were closed. But their government provided subsidies, banks also stopped lending, and supplies were guaranteed. Most people were not affected. What about China? You stopped lending, but your mortgage and car loans did not stop, and you still had to buy groceries at high prices, and you still had to thank the government for saving your life. Not many people died from the new crown, because suicides don't count.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: What is the difference between China's epidemic prevention methods today and those in 2020? There is no difference. It is meaningless to use the methods in 2020 to prevent it. You can't close the city in time due to the infectiousness, and it is meaningless to close the city due to the mortality rate. You also know it is meaningless, so you take the positive away and throw the bed and quilt to let him sit in prison. As a result, when the old man in Xinjiang was really seriously ill yesterday, there was not even a ventilator in the isolation center.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Zhengzhou official media previously announced that 30% of the positive cases were tested for nucleic acid infection. Even so, aren't you still asked to go downstairs every day for nucleic acid testing? If you really want to prevent the epidemic, it would be useful to weld the iron door of the people and lock them up for a month. But does the rigid system allow this? It is not allowed. The government doesn't know what to do, so it can only do nucleic acid testing with its head held high, so you have to do it even if you risk infection every time. It's that simple.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
So in the end it became a vicious circle: the more nucleic acid tests were done, the more positive they were, and in the end there were too many, so they had no choice but to take all the people away on buses. They deceived themselves by declaring victory by "zero social clearance".
What did the dynamic zero clearance clear in the end?
It cleared the government's finances, the people's wallets, and the people's trust in the government.
And what about the virus? It is happily heading to the next city.
Today, let us wish the new coronavirus a happy birthday.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
I like some non-fiction literature
March 16
"Look at how many people died in Hong Kong in one day after the government relaxed its restrictions"
April 9
"The Shanghai Municipal Committee should kowtow to the Guangzhou Municipal Committee"
May 8
"Look at the hundreds of people dying every day abroad, do you really want to all lie down?"
November 9
"I would rather die of illness than starve to death or die of poverty. This disease is like a cold, don't bother with it..."

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Another point to emphasize is that Europe's "unblocking" is also gradual. After the vaccine is gradually popularized, only those who have been vaccinated and hold a Green Pass can take trains and planes and enter shopping malls, hotels and schools. It was not until last year that most people received three shots of the vaccine that Europeans have resumed their normal lives. This is also a long process. If China eventually wants to return to normal, it will not be able to escape this process.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Why are there still people asking me if I should stock up on food when I am in Guangzhou?
I thought every Chinese person had already stored at least two months' worth of food at home in case of emergency.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Since Shanghai, I have told everyone on Weibo that you should have at least two months of food at home. It sounds like a lot, but it is not. You only need to stock up on the most basic rice, flour, salt and oil to ensure that you will not starve to death if you have no food for more than a month of lockdown.
This is your safety line
Of course, if you have space at home, you can even buy a bean sprout machine, mushroom box and other things to prepare, and they are available on Taobao, which is very convenient.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: As for fresh meat, eggs, milk and vegetables, you can't store them. They will go bad if you leave them alone, so you have to buy them now. And in order to ensure that you have enough food, you should try to buy food as much as possible during the lockdown. Prepare food for when necessary. Of course, there is one more thing, you must protect your food reserves and put them in a place where Dabai can't find them. Because it is very likely that you will be taken to quarantine, and your home will be cleared when you return, and all your previous preparations will be ruined. So you have to hide them well.

content:
Rumor-busting correction:
A Weibo blogger released an eight-minute full video
The video shows that the real situation is that residents of the community gathered at the entrance of the community and demanded that all positive patients in the community be taken away.
It is not that Liu Hongying is positive.
This correction is hereby attached with the full video
